title: Virgin Orbit awaiting license for first U.K. launch
summary: Virgin Orbit says it is technically ready for its next LauncherOne mission, and the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom, but is still waiting on a launch license from the British government.

title: India on track for OneWeb launch in second half of October
summary: India expects to conduct the first launch of OneWeb satellites in eight months during the second half of October, Indian space agency ISRO said Oct. 5.

title: York Space wins $200 million Space Development Agency contract for 12 satellites
summary: York Space won a $200 million contract for the Space Development Agency's Tranche 1 Demonstration and Experimentation System (T1DES) program

title: SpaceX to carry Intelsat Galaxy sats on third launch of the week
summary: SpaceX is set to launch Intelsat’s Galaxy 33 (G-33) and Galaxy 34 (G-34) satellites on Thursday, Oct. 6, at 7:07 PM EDT (23:07 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

title: Dual satellite launch for Intelsat next on SpaceX’s launch schedule
summary: For the third time in 31 hours, SpaceX is poised to fire a Falcon 9 rocket into space Thursday, this time on a mission from Cape Canaveral with two commercial Intelsat television broadcasting satellites heading for geostationary orbit that are part of a multibillion-dollar program to clear C-band frequencies for 5G wireless services.

title: UK competition watchdog has concerns about Viasat’s Inmarsat takeover
summary: Viasat’s $7.3 billion Inmarsat takeover could lead to more expensive and poorer quality Wi-Fi for plane passengers, the U.K.’s competition watchdog said Oct. 6 as it prepared to launch a full-scale probe of the deal.

title: Sierra Space hires former SpaceX executive as CIO
summary: Sierra Space has hired a former SpaceX executive as its chief information officer as the company builds up its infrastructure to support work on commercial spacecraft and a space station.

title: Roscosmos official supports continued cooperation with NASA on ISS
summary: After a successful launch of a Crew Dragon spacecraft whose crew included a Russian cosmonaut, a Roscosmos official struck a more conciliatory tone about relations with NASA.

title: Report highlights U.S. concerns over China’s space infrastructure in South America
summary: The expansion of Chinese ground stations in South America is generating concern regarding Beijing’s intentions in the region and in space, according to a new report.

title: Next NOAA weather satellite launching just in time
summary: NOAA is preparing to launch the Joint Polar Satellite System-2 on Nov. 1 from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California.
